title: Modified Asthma Predictive Index (mAPI)
description: Predicts future asthma onset probability in pediatric patients ≤3 years old with recurrent wheezing episodes

parameters.name: wheezing_episodes_per_year
parameters.description: Number of wheezing episodes per year (≥4 required for mAPI applicability)

parameters.name: atopic_dermatitis
parameters.description: Patient has physician-diagnosed atopic dermatitis (major criteria)

parameters.name: aeroallergen_sensitivity
parameters.description: Patient has demonstrated aeroallergen sensitivity through skin tests or blood tests (major criteria)

parameters.name: eosinophils_4_percent
parameters.description: Eosinophils ≥4% on complete blood count (minor criteria)

parameters.name: food_allergies
parameters.description: Documented allergy to milk, egg, or peanuts (minor criteria)

result.name: mapi_result
result.description: mAPI result indicating asthma risk prediction

ranges.interpretation: Low risk of future asthma development. mAPI is negative when <4 wheezing episodes per year OR (<1 major criteria AND <2 minor criteria).
Increased risk of future asthma development. mAPI is positive when ≥4 wheezing episodes per year AND (≥1 major criteria OR ≥2 minor criteria).

references: Guilbert TW, Morgan WJ, Zeiger RS, Mauger DT, Boehmer SJ, Szefler SJ, et al. Long-term inhaled corticosteroids in preschool children at high risk for asthma. N Engl J Med. 2006 May 11;354(19):1985-97. doi: 10.1056/NEJMoa051378.

Chang TS, Lemanske RF, Guilbert TW, Gern JE, Coen MH, Evans MD, et al. Evaluation of the modified asthma predictive index in high-risk preschoolers. J Allergy Clin Immunol Pract. 2013 Mar-Apr;1(2):152-6. doi: 10.1016/j.jaip.2012.10.008.

Castro-Rodríguez JA, Holberg CJ, Wright AL, Martinez FD. A clinical index to define risk of asthma in young children with recurrent wheezing. Am J Respir Crit Care Med. 2000 Oct;162(4 Pt 1):1403-6. doi: 10.1164/ajrccm.162.4.9912111.
formula: mAPI positive if: ≥4 wheezing episodes per year AND (≥1 major criteria OR ≥2 minor criteria). Major criteria: parent asthma, atopic dermatitis, aeroallergen sensitivity. Minor criteria: wheezing unrelated to colds, eosinophils ≥4%, food allergies.
notes: Only applicable to children ≤3 years old with ≥4 wheezing episodes per year
Does not guarantee future asthma diagnosis
Clinical utility depends on local asthma prevalence
Modified version adds food allergies as minor criteria compared to original API
